stream_context.summary: Kaze continued building Part 13 of the island-wide overworld, refining mountain–forest transitions, carving pads for ruined Yoshi houses, and experimenting with a tall pirate crow’s-nest structure.  He brain-stormed secret-star concepts, ultimately replacing a scrapped “Peach visit” idea with a ‘blue rain flower’ quest that ties into Bowser’s Builders and the destroyed Yoshi village.  The stream also veered into hardware optimisation (cooler N64 runs fractionally faster), tooling (ROM Manager, Quad64, static-recomp PC builds), and content-creation logistics (Squarespace sponsorship).

development_findings.summary: Preliminary tests suggest an N64 runs ~0.1 % slower after heating; Kaze is considering code-side optimisations that reduce console temperature as a real (and comedic) speed gain.
development_findings.quote: It looks like the N64 may get like 0.1 % slower when it's warm… saving a couple microseconds that way would be hilarious.

development_findings.summary: Toadstool is obsolete; current level editing relies on ROM Manager (since 2018) and Quad64 because they are open, maintained, and bug-free compared to Toadstool.
development_findings.quote: There really is no reason to use Toadstool. It is closed-source and has a bunch of bugs you can’t fix.

development_findings.summary: Kaze dismisses the public ‘PC port’ as a proof-of-concept, advocating Wiseguy’s static-recompilation build for future PC releases and is open to porting the hack to it once finished.
development_findings.quote: If people ask me to put my mod on the static recompilation, I’d be much more open to that.

development_findings.summary: The full island overworld is now reachable 360°, with gating handled by items (ice cap, lighthouse beam, bomb cap) and a pause-menu map that doubles as a warp selector.
Design rule: every overworld star must meaningfully alter the environment, keeping the world ‘alive’.
development_findings.quote: I want every star in the overworld to kind of transform the overworld in a way.

development_findings.summary: New secret-star plan: a large blue ‘rain flower’ causes perpetual rain; rebuilding Yoshi houses via Bowser’s Builders cheers it up, turns it yellow, ends the rain, and spawns a star.
development_findings.quote: She’s sad because the Yoshis are sad… once the houses are rebuilt she turns yellow, spawns a star, and the rain stops.

development_findings.summary: A tall pirate crow’s-nest will be integrated into coastal cliffs as a climbable set-piece, potentially hiding a treasure-map star.
Eight additional secret stars still need concepts; criteria are that each must reshape the overworld on completion.
Narrative detail: Bowser’s Builders defected after OSHA-level safety abuses in Koopa Carnival and can now be hired to repair Yoshi dwellings.
development_findings.quote: Bowser's Builders are initially part of Bowser's crew, but after the working conditions and the OSHA violations… they decided to desert.

development_findings.summary: Multiple distinct Yoshis will populate the island; destroyed homes are being plotted as raised platforms waiting for reconstruction.

context_findings.summary: Kaze felt mentally exhausted minutes into the stream and grew irritated with off-topic chat, acknowledging that reading chat can tilt him.
context_findings.quote: Before starting the stream I felt so positive… and now I'm already mentally exhausted.

context_findings.summary: He describes himself as largely unemotional and doesn’t measure development by ‘fun’.
context_findings.quote: Fun is not really something I think about when I make stuff.

context_findings.summary: Financial pressure: a Squarespace sponsorship requires six videos in three months; the high payout is needed, influencing his upcoming schedule.
context_findings.quote: They need me to make six videos in three months, but they pay really well, and I need money.

context_findings.summary: Personal background: originally from Germany, now lives in Canada; day-job work uses Unreal Engine, which he finds bloated.
Philosophy on corporations: sees them as profit-maximising, morally neutral entities; consumer complaints are pointless without withholding purchases.
context_findings.quote: A corporation is as close to moral neutral as it can be… If you actually wanted to complain, maybe don’t buy the game.

context_findings.summary: He worries about negative comment floods; avoids opinionated videos (e.g., PC-port critique) to dodge thousands of argumentative replies.
context_findings.quote: The problem with expressing any kind of opinion in my videos is that I get way too many comments to argue with them.

biobak.summary: Biobak previously joked that Kaze might be autistic; Kaze cites it while discussing sensory preferences and self-diagnosis.
biobak.quote: Maybe Biobak was right. Maybe I really am autistic.

zeina.summary: Zeina’s Switch was used for Kaze’s brief (and aborted) Hollow Knight test; no direct project work mentioned.

key_stories.title: Chasing Cooler Console Speeds
key_stories.summary: Kaze noticed marginal slowdown on long N64 sessions and theorises temperature as the culprit. He plans to profile component temps and write code that keeps hardware cooler.
key_stories.challenge: N64 appears 0.1 % slower after three hours of heat.
key_stories.process: Consulted a community tester, discussed gathering precise data and exploring heat-reducing code paths.
key_stories.outcome: Experiment pending; could yield both a genuine micro-optimisation and a humorous video hook.
key_stories.key_quote: We might have to do optimisations that make the N64 run not as hot, and I think that would be really funny.

key_stories.title: From Peach Idea to Rain-Flower Quest
key_stories.summary: Originally a star was to feature Peach vacationing on the beach; Kaze rejected it as uninteresting and conceived a ‘blue rain flower’ whose sadness rains on the island until Yoshi homes are rebuilt.
key_stories.challenge: Need a memorable overworld star that changes the world without generic platforming.
key_stories.process: Brain-stormed live, scrapped Peach, invented rain-flower, linked its mood to destroyed Yoshi houses and Bowser’s Builders quest.
key_stories.outcome: New star approved; will visually end rainfall and reward player after reconstruction cut-scene.
key_stories.key_quote: This works. Fuck this Peach star.

key_stories.title: Advocating Static Recompilation
key_stories.summary: Chat raised PC ports; Kaze critiqued the popular decompilation port as a hastily slapped-together demo and promoted Wiseguy’s static-recomp build as the proper modding future.
key_stories.challenge: Widespread community use of a port Kaze deems technically inferior.
key_stories.process: Explained drawbacks of existing port, highlighted static-recomp benefits, and signalled openness to releasing the hack on that platform.
key_stories.outcome: Positions the documentary to explore potential official PC release path after N64 version ships.
key_stories.key_quote: If people ask me to put my mod on the static recompilation, I would be much more open to that.

key_stories.title: eBay Lawsuit Scare
key_stories.summary: Kaze was once sued over a Kirby 64 sale when the buyer falsely claimed an empty package. He feared Nintendo litigation but proved innocence via tracked-shipping weight.
key_stories.challenge: Buyer accused him of theft; legal summons arrived.
key_stories.process: Kept shipping receipts, provided evidence to police, represented himself without lawyer.
key_stories.outcome: Case dismissed before court; formative experience with legal anxiety.
key_stories.key_quote: When I first got the message like ‘you have been sued’… I thought Nintendo finally did it, but nope—it was this one dipshit from eBay.
